intro: Nemophila hispida, commonly known as the hairy blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, sky-blue flowers and hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Nemophila hispida is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
